intro: Veronica spicata var. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered speedwell, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright, branched stems. The plant produces clusters of small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, providing a textured appearance. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
